entries.title: Israel: After weeks of difficult negotiations, Benjamin Netanyahu announces a new government
entries.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made the announcement said late on Wednesday, moments before a midnight deadline.

entries.title: Kylian Mbappé already back at PSG before what could be a strained reunion with Lionel Messi
entries.description: On Wednesday, barely three days after the final, the World Cup top scorer returned to training with PSG. Lionel Messi is still in Argentina, where the festivities have sometimes taken an ugly turn toward the French striker.

entries.title: 'Emily in Paris' review: Time for a season of 'Emily Away from Paris'
entries.description: In her picture-perfect Paris, the American influencer starts to find that time passes slowly in the third season, or maybe it's just slower for the viewers.

entries.title: Ukraine's Zelensky gets White House welcome from Biden before talks
entries.description: Just before Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's arrival, the US announced its largest single delivery of arms to Ukraine, including Patriot surface-to-air missiles.

entries.title: US sending Patriot missile system to Ukraine as part of $1.85 billion in military aid
entries.description: The MIM-104 Patriot is a surface-to-air missile system initially developed to intercept high-flying aircraft. Ukraine's air defenses have played a key role in protecting the country from strikes and preventing Moscow's forces from gaining control of the skies.

entries.title: French Christmas set to be disrupted by train strike
entries.description: France's national rail operator SNCF announced major service cancellations this weekend due to a strike.

entries.title: French tycoon Vincent Bolloré exits African ports and railways
entries.description: The group said on Wednesday it had completed the sale of its port terminals and rail lines to Italian-Swiss shipowner MSC for €5.7 billion.

entries.title: 'Puss in Boots 2: The Last Wish': The musketeer cat returns, in the middle of an existential crisis
entries.description: Eleven years after his adventure began, the minor character of the 'Shrek' saga is back, less egocentric but still with great style.

entries.title: French academics asks International Criminal Court to investigate deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia
entries.description: Filed by a group of academics, the request is based on investigations of international media and reports including one published in November by Amnesty International.

entries.title: The obstacles faced by the Committee investigating US Capitol attacks
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump, backed by Republican House representatives, did everything he could to thwart the investigations, even pressuring some witnesses.

entries.title: Drawing comparisons to Britney Spears, an Egyptian singer is stirring women's rights talks
entries.description: Internationally acclaimed Sherine Abdel Wahab has been in Egyptian tabloids for months following accusations of domestic violence and an alleged forced rehab stint.

entries.title: The Swedish model is breaking down
entries.description: Major reforms carried out over the past 30 years have profoundly transformed the Nordic country known to be an egalitarian country with a strong welfare system.

entries.title: Mbappé to Les Bleus: 'We couldn't possibly play worse than we have'
entries.description: A documentary aired on Tuesday on France's campaign in Qatar shows the team's striker give a bustling half-time talk.

entries.title: Russia will continue improving combat capabilities, Putin says
entries.description: During a meeting with the country's high-ranking officers on Wednesday, Russia's defense minister proposed increasing the number of combat personnel in the army.

entries.title: Italy's Meloni backtracks on budget
entries.description: Keen to maintain good relations with Brussels, the Italian Prime Minister had to give up on several campaign promises.

entries.title: The European Commission wants to toughen its fight against human trafficking
entries.description: Brussels is proposing to implement mandatory sanctions against users of services resulting from victim exploitation, but NGOs are critical of this proposal.

entries.title: Malaysia floods leave at least five dead, force over 70,000 to evacuate
entries.description: Monsoon-triggered floods inundated the country's north, with evacuations taking place in Kelantan, Terengganu, Pahang, Johor and Perak states.

entries.title: Vega-C rocket fails after lift-off, a major setback for Europe
entries.description: The rocket had been trying to bring into orbit two Earth observation satellites, intended to join a network capable of capturing high-quality images on the globe.

entries.title: Ambulance workers join widening UK strikes
entries.description: After nurses on Tuesday, thousands of ambulance workers in Britain began a 24-hour strike on Wednesday.

entries.title: COP15: 'There has been no progress on eliminating subsidies harming nature over the past 10 years'
entries.description: Environmentalist Paul Leadley – advisor to the negotiators of the UN Biodiversity Conference – assesses the agreement which was adopted on Monday in Montreal for 'Le Monde.'

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Volodymyr Zelensky embarks on a surprise visit to Washington to consolidate US support
entries.description: For the Ukrainian president, this trip is a way to embody once again the cause of his country in the American debate, even as public opinion grows weary.

entries.title: French government finalizes new immigration bill
entries.description: The majority is counting on the support of right-wing party Les Républicains to pass its bill. It will be reviewed par Parliament next year.

entries.title: China reports no new Covid-19 deaths after changing definition of Covid fatality
entries.description: The government announced that only those who directly died of respiratory failure caused by the virus would be counted under Covid death statistics.

entries.title: Zelensky plans US visit in first trip abroad since war began
entries.description: Volodymyr Zelensky's visit, expected on Wednesday, reportedly includes a meeting with Joe Biden in the White House for an announcement of a fresh package of military aid for Ukraine.

entries.title: Electricity: in France, the risk of outages is fading for the near future
entries.description: RTE, which manages the French electrical grid, now anticipates only a 'medium' risk of pressure rather than 'high' as it had done a month earlier.

entries.title: Brazil: Art and bullets in a sprawling Rio favela
entries.description: The Azulejaria collective, which works in the Maré neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro, has just installed a memorial to the victims of gun violence in collaboration with a group of mothers and families who have lost a loved one to the never-ending gang war.

entries.title: Across Europe, prices are increasing and wages falling
entries.description: With Europe's inflation at 10%, the cost of living crisis has hurt workers throughout the continent. The European Central Bank is weary of a wage-price spiral, like in the 1970s.

entries.title: South Africa: A weakened President Ramaphosa remains at the helm of the ANC
entries.description: Threatened with impeachment just a week ago, the South African president is now a lame duck.

entries.title: In Iran, art as a catalyst for revolt
entries.description: Public fountains with blood-red water, theater and dance performances... Everywhere in the country, political contestation is taking the form of artistic creation.

entries.title: 'Qatargate': 'the time has come to establish a European authority for transparency and ethics'
entries.description: Although the rules governing lobbying activities have evolved, the new corruption affair affecting the European Parliament highlights the need to create an independent control body, writes Stéphane Rodrigues, lecturer in European and public law at the University of Paris-I-Panthéon-Sorbonne.

entries.title: Trump taxes: House panel to release report on returns
entries.description: Lawmakers indicated after the vote on Tuesday that the world could see redacted copies  of Donald Trump's tax filings within a couple of days.

entries.title: Elon Musk says he will step down as Twitter CEO once successor found
entries.description: 'I will resign as CEO as soon as I find someone foolish enough to take the job!' Mr. Musk tweeted on Tuesday, saying he will then run software and server teams at Twitter.

entries.title: Peru Congress opens door to early elections amid unrest
entries.description: A proposal, approved by legislators on Tuesday, would push up to April 2024 elections for president and congress originally scheduled for 2026. The plan must still be ratified by another two-thirds majority in the next annual legislative session for it to be adopted.

entries.title: Faced with inflation, the French are massively turning to discount stores
entries.description: Consumers are looking for discounts and low prices by any means, multiplying shopping channels, buying large quantities and stocking up. New players are emerging.
